title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the tongue of land formed by the confluence of these rivers, stands the village of Logierait, eight and a half miles from Dunkeld.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Passing the inn and village of Logierait, situated on the tongue of the peninsula formed by the junction of the Tay and the Tummel, we proceed along the east bank of the latter, passing Tullymet (Wm. Dick, Esq.) in a northern glen, where a Roman Catholic chapel has recently been erected.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Issuing thence, it speedily receives a great augmentation by the river Lyon, and running north and east at Logierait, about eight miles above Dunkeld, it is joined by the Tummel.

snippet: Towards the end of September, he sent them all to Perth, and marched the non-commissioned officers and privates to Logierait, in Athole.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: * Close by Logierait are vestiges of a castle built by Robert III.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The son of a clergyman at Logierait, in Athol, hewas himself destined to the Church, took orders,and went as chaplain to the Black Watch, or 4'2dHighland regiment, when that corps was first sentto the continent.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: "In this parish are evident traces of a Northernpopulation, the name itself Logierait, being theLagbierget or Law Mount of the AncientScandinavians."
